[[File:1963 - Mrs Gill.jpg|thumb]] On [[21 February]] [[1963]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to Mrs Gill'''. '''Mrs Gill 21 February 1963''' is a [[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|letter]] from [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] to Mrs. Gill, composed on [[21 February]] [[1963]].{{CG|C}}, p. 604 *'''Subject''': Tolkien replies to a letter of appreciation of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' from Mrs Gill. *'''Publication:''' A description of the letter was included in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]: Chronology'' (p. 604). *'''Description:''' One page, typerscript, signed.[http://www.robertedwardauctions.com/auction/2005/1374.html Lot1374 (2005)] at [http://www.robertedwardauctions.com Robertedwardauctions] (accessedd 02 April 2014) ==Transcription== {{blockquote|Dear Mrs. Gill,

Thank you very much for your letter. I am so glad you have found pleasure and encouragement in The Lord of the Rings,...I was surprised to learn that you had to wait two years for Vol. III...I regard this as a most gratifying testimonial.

With best wishes,

Yours sincerely,

J.R.R.Tolkien}} {{references}} [[Category:Letters|Gill, Mrs]]
